Name: ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid production, alkaline cyanomethylation of ethylenediamine | EDTA, ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: According to Hart (2000) the industial production of EDTA is made nowadays with two different techniques – the alkaline cyanomethylation of ethylenediamine by sodium cyanide and formaldehyde / two-step Singer synthesis. For this dataset, only the first production technique is taken into consideration, as it is the most widely used synthesis method. The overall reaction is the following:;H2NCH2CH2NH2 + 4 CH2O + 4 NaCN + 4 H2O → (NaOOCCH2)2NCH2CH2N(CH2COONa)2 + 4 NH3;With this production method, very high yields (> 90%) can be achieved. The by-product ammonia is usually boiled off during the reaction (Hart 2000).;For this dataset, a process yield of 95% is assumed. The inventory is based on stoechiometric calculations. The emissions to air (0.2 wt% of raw material input) and water were estimated using mass balance. Treatment of the wastewater in an internal wastewater treatment plant is assumed (elimination efficiency of 90% for C).;Reference:;Hischier R. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Packagings & Graphical Papers. ecoinvent report No. 11. Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.;Hart R. J. (2000) Ethylenediaminetetraacetic Acid and Related Chelating Agents. In: Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Sixth Edition, June-2001 Electronic Release (ed. Häussinger P., Leitgeb P. and Schmücker B.), 6 th Electronic Release Edition. Wiley InterScience, New York, Online-Version under: http://www.mrw.interscience.wiley.com/ueic/ull_search_fs.html.
